abstract: Sculpture by artist Ohad Meromi, which is set to be installed on traffic median in Long Island City, Queens, as part of New York City's Percent for Art program, draws criticism from area's residents who say piece is too large, bright and expensive.
lead_paragraph: A meeting will be held to address residents’ concerns as a debate about the project has dovetailed with conversations about the city’s public art program and the arts scene in the Queens neighborhood.

headline.main: Outcry Over Pink Sculpture Intersects With Broader Questions in Long Island City
headline.print_headline: Outcry Over a Sculpture, and Questions on a Neighborhood’s Future

snippet: A meeting will be held to address residents’ concerns as a debate about the project has dovetailed with conversations about the city’s public art program and the arts scene in the Queens neighborhood.
